description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration
Relación de bienes estimados necesarios para el fortalecimiento de la FESNOJIV con respecto a los bienes adquiridos por unidad de tiempo

comment.narrative: Desde el año 2003 se ha venido efectuando la dotación y modernización de equipos e instrumentos musicales de la FESNOJIV y sus núcleos a través de los proyectos 15549 y 15561.
Continuación de los procesos de adquisiciones iniciados en 2014

Del proceso licitatorio iniciado en el año 2014 en el marco de este componente, fueron entregados en 2015 1.245 En el marco del proceso Licitatorio IAL/FUNDAMUSICAL/2014, fue completada desde el 30/09/2015 la adquisición de 1.245 Instrumentos Musicales discriminados en 420 Violines, 140 Violincellos, 50 Clarinetes, 50 Fagots, 80 Cornos, 60 Trombones, 160 Violas, 105 Contrabajos, 75 Flautas, 50 Oboes, 40 Trompetas y 15 Tubas.

description.narrative: Apoyar la gestión y estudios requeridos por el proyecto, información actualizada y relevante para la difusión del proyecto, además de cumplir con los procesos de auditorías requeridos para evaluación de los resultados del proyecto.
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Apoyar la gestión y estudios requeridos por el proyecto, información actualizada y relevante para la difusión del proyecto, además de cumplir con los procesos de auditorías requeridos para evaluación de los resultados del proyecto.

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration

independent political entity
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Apoyar la consolidación de la Fundación Musical Bolívar dando continuidad al proceso de fortalecimiento de los núcleos y orquestas de El Sistema a través de la adquisición de instrumentos musicales y equipos de alto nivel.

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - policy, planning and administration
No de Instrumentos Musicales, Accesorios y Equipos menores adquiridos en el marco del componente Simón Bolívar

comment.narrative: La incorporación de niños, niñas y adolescentes a El Sistema, se encuentra condicionada a la adquisición de instrumentos musicales, accesorios y equipos menores. Al 31/012/13 el inventario acumulado del proyecto evidencia las siguientes adquisiciones: Instrumentos Musicales: 462 Accesorios Musicales: 2.574 Equipos Menores: 145

Dar continuidad al proceso de dotación iniciado en el año 2014 para la adquisición de Mobiliario Musical e Instrumentos Musicalespara dar cumplimiento a la incorporación de 1.000.000 de niños, niñas y adolescentes al sistema durante el período 2013- 2019

El Proceso Licitatorio CD/051/FUNDAMUSICAL/2014 fue completado al 31/12/2015 con la adquisición de 55.900 unidades de Mobiliario Musical adicionales a las ya adquiridas en el año 2014. En el marco del Proceso Licitatorio IAL/040/FUNDAMUSICAL/2014 al 31/12/2015 fueron adquiridos 54.770 Instrumentos musicales discriminados en 21.378 Cuatros de Concierto, 24.752 Cuatros de Estudios y 8.640 Cuatros Iniciales. La adquisición de otros instrumentos musicales previstos desde el Plan de Procura del año 2014 se ha visto limitada por inconvenientes presentados en la convertibilidad a USD dólares de los recursos en bolívares depositados por FUNDAMUSICAL.

description.narrative: PIMS 4191 FORTALECIMIENTO DEL SISTEMA DE ÁREAS PROTEGIDAS MARINOCOSTERA DE VENEZUELA

title.narrative: Evaluación de medio termino del proyecto GEF PIMS 4191 Atlas 75653 Fortalecimiento del sistema de áreas protegidas marino-costera de Venezuela

description.narrative: Este proyecto se enfocará en un rango de amenazas que actualmente afectan o potencialmente podrían afectar la biodiversidad de la zona marino-costera de Venezuela, a través de la expansión y fortalecimiento del sistema de áreas protegidas
independent political entity

activity-description.narrative: Establecimiento de planes de ordenamiento y reglamento de uso, monitoreo de parámetros ecológicos clave, diversificación financiera y estructuras de co-gestión en los estados costeros y área marina de Venezuela.

description.narrative: Environment - policy, planning and administration
To promote inter-sector approaches to BD conservation through the tourism and fisheries sectors

Improvements in the conservation status of Objects of Conservation (OCs) in the coastal/marine zone, measured by proportions of OCs with different levels of conservation status (as defined by PDVSA/ INTECMAR/USB/TNC study)

comment.narrative:
Conservation status % of OCs
Threatened 29%
Moderate status 43%
Very good status 28%

Conservation status % of OCs
Threatened 6%
Moderate status 47%
Very good status 47%

The results obtained in Outcome 2, have helped to decrease the degree of threat of Protected Areas with the majority of Conservation Objectives (OC). This underpinned by the administrators of the areas who have updated management tools that allow them to optimize decision-making.

description.narrative: Increase in the average total METT rating for protected areas in the project area

comment.narrative: 27,31 (out of a possible 97,54)
64,10 (out of a possible 89,22)

In the first quarter of 2015, a total of 12 meetings were held with administrators of Protected Areas for the induction of this methodology. These meetings resulted in the definition of the strategy from the institutional point of view, for filling the METT tool by Protected Areas managers.
The results showed progress in the overall score, and specific discussions showed the need for further efforts in terms of personnel management, equipment, infrastructure, and detailed planning of areas and aspects related to budget and the financial management system.
For the workshop (with a duration of two days), a total of 20 people were involved. The updated METT shows as a result an increase in the total average of 7.19 points (improving the base value by 53.8%). The result of the current evaluation is 34.5/97.54, compared to the initial situation of 27.31/97.54.

description.narrative: Enhanced institutional, legal and policy framework developed to efficiently manage Marine and Coastal Protected Areas (MCPA)
Increase in METT scores related to management instruments (categories 1-4 – see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2)

comment.narrative: The updated METT shows a result of 3.51/12, which represents an increase in values of 48% from the base value calculated at the start of the project (2.63/12). This increase is sustained on improvements in the technical training of staff and the inclusion of a greater number of technical staff related to some of the areas evaluated.

description.narrative: Availability of geographical information to key decision makers

comment.narrative:
Only basic cartographic information is included in the Simón Bolívar Geoportal
Simón Bolívar Geoportal has recently been established and is not yet fully operational

75 layers of key information for PA management, covering the project area, are available on line, of which 10 are continuously updated in real time
70 key institutional stakeholders (Directorates of Ministries, Universities) and 18 PA managers in INPARQUES have downloaded and used key information in previous 3 months

It has been obtained an advance of 50% in the definition of the key information levels which will feature the Information System for Management Planning (SIGOT for its acronyms in Spanish). Similarly, there is an index of information on Protected Areas with a total of 45 layers. Also, the cartographic information of each management instrument is being updated. A total of 6 meetings with key stakeholders and institutions and 14 Protected Areas supervisors were conducted to define the type of information to update. One out of the two visualization facilities is currently installed in a 100%. The other facility shows a progress of around 20%.

description.narrative: PA managers have access to tools and instruments for the management, the design, and the declaration or expansion of PAs within the coastal/marine area
Total area of priority ABRAEs

comment.narrative:
Area: 5,662,682 ha
Number: 49

Corridor: 5,075,051 ha (1)
New PA: 2,060,297 ha (4)
PA Expansions: 1,719,153 ha (11)
Additional total 8,854,501 ha (5)
Cumulative Total 14,517,183 ha (54)

In the reporting period they have been addressed a total of 19 Protected Areas, with a surface of approximately 1,206,709.49 ha. This implies a rise of 12.52% of the area established in the PRODOC. Progress was also made in the drafting of a document that addresses general criteria for connectivity between Protected Areas in the coastal marine area.
Regarding new Protected Areas, the project addressed a total of 7 new areas covering an approximate surface of 160,440 ha. With regard to the expansion of existing Protected Areas, the project addressed 3 areas, with a total surface of 152,525 ha. The strategy has been to cover smaller surface areas, and therefore more manageable, seeking the representativeness of priority ecosystems added to the existing system.
Given the fact that official publication of management instruments is outside the competence of the Ministry for Ecosocialism and Water, it is highlighted recent changes in the approval processes of this type of management tools. However, the addressed instruments have covered the process of public and institutional consultation established by law.

description.narrative: Proportion of the 49 priority ABRAEs in the project area with management plans (PORUs)

comment.narrative:
Current | %
Quantity: 24 | 49%
Area: 1,951,183 ha | 34%

Cumulative | %
Quantity: 37 | 49%
Area: 2,341,363 ha | 35%

A total of 8 out of 13 elaborations management instruments (PORU for its acronyms in Spanish) have been addresses. This advance represents the 62% towards the target. However, the project has exceeded the target in terms of surface by 105.9%, reaching a total of 528,771 ha, improving the goal by 390,180 ha.

description.narrative: Proportion of the 24 priority ABRAEs in the project area with PORUs, whose PORUs are less than 20 years old

comment.narrative:
Current | %
Quantity: 7 | 29%
Area: 1,025,843 ha | 53%

Cumulative | %
Quantity: 20 | 83%
Area: 1,416,023 ha | 73%
At the time, 6 out of 13 upgrades have been addressed. Regarding the goal surface (390,180 ha), these 6 PORU mean 94% of the target, getting to date a total of 364,973.55 ha.

description.narrative: Proportion of ABRAEs in the project area with PORUs produced since 1990, which are being implemented

comment.narrative:
Current | %
Quantity: 3 | 43%
Area: 967,004 ha | 94%

Cumulative | %
Quantity: 7 | 100%
Area: 1,025,843 ha | 100%
A total of 4 PORU selected for implementation have been approved by law. In this regard, the goal have been reached in a 100%.

description.narrative: Total METT rating for PAs in relation to management tools and capacities (criteria 5-23 – see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2)

comment.narrative: The updated METT shows a value of 21,04/58, resulting in 54.28% of progress towards the goal (38.76/58). All management tools were taken into account improving the following indicators: area management implementation, management plans, resource inventory and staff training.

description.narrative: The SMPA is supported by a sustainable financial system and increased revenues
Government funding for PAs in the project area

comment.narrative: Estimated amount $1.5 million (22% of estimated needs), to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup
Estimated amount $2 million (30% above current level) to be confirmed during process of financial analysis at project startup

Diagnostics were made for 7 Protected Areas referred to the different types of income. As a result, there are guidelines to develop specific mechanisms for planning and financial management capacity assessment of supervisors according to available funds, and the proposed mechanisms for increasing diversification of revenues. These diagnostics, constitutes the base to formulate the financial plan for the Protected Areas System.

description.narrative: Amount of funding for PAs in the project area from sources other than Government recurrent budget

comment.narrative: To be determined during process of financial analysis at project startup
Estimated amount 20% above current level
It is planned to be determined in the extension period.

description.narrative: Amount of funds generated by individual PAs

comment.narrative: To be determined during process of financial analysis at project startup
Estimated amount 50% above current level
It is planned to be determined in the extension period.

description.narrative: Total METT rating for PAs in relation to financial sustainability issues (criteria 1-4 and 24-31 – see ProDoc Annex 14 Section 2)

comment.narrative: The updated METT value shows a value from 7.38/39 to 9.9/39. The indicators which showed improvement were those related to access and decision-making processes for existing communities and indigenous communities where applicable.

description.narrative: Total rating for UNDP Financial Sustainability Scorecard

comment.narrative: the results indicated an increase towards the goal of 30%, only for 7 of the 49 prioritized areas, these belong to the PA administrated by the Ministry.
